item.title: fuzzy hashing
item.description: Fuzzy hashing helps us to perform similarity analysis - match two files with minor differences based on the fuzzy hash values. One of the examples of fuzzy hashing is the usage of SSDeep.

item.description: Pyramid of Pain is a conceptual model which organizes IOCs(Indicators Of Compromise) with the level of difficulty it will cause for an adversary to change the indicators associated ...

item.title: Reconnaissance
item.description: Reconnaissance (MITRE Tactic TA0043) is discovering and collecting information on the system and the victim. The reconnaissance phase is the planning phase for the adversaries.

item.title: SIEM
item.description: What is SIEM? SIEM is a security solution that combines security information and event management, which involves real-time logging of events in an environment ...

item.title: SOAR
item.description: SOAR (Security Orchestration Automation and Response) SOAR stands for Security Orchestration Automation and Response. It enables security products and tools in an environment to work together, streamlining the tasks of SOC team members.
